snippet: Any change to managing web addresses and domain names must strengthen a system used by billions.
abstract: Editorial examines proposal by the Commerce Department to hand oversight of the Internet's domain name system to a global community of businesses, public interest groups, academics and governments; holds that any government influence should be viewed with skepticism, and that changes should be scrutinized for effect they may have on universal and free access that has defined Internet since its inception.
lead_paragraph: Any change to managing web addresses and domain names must strengthen a system used by billions.

keywords.value: Internet Corp for Assigned Names and Numbers
keywords.name: organizations
